Modules¶

Methods¶

Name: Grass Codec (DNA Storage Code created by Grass)

Reference: Grass R N, Heckel R, Puddu M, et al. Robust Chemical Preservation of Digital Information on DNA in Silica with Error‐Correcting Codes[J]. Angewandte Chemie International Edition, 2015, 54(8): 2552-2555.

Coder: HaoLing ZHANG (BGI-Research)[V1]

Current Version: 1

Function(s): (1) DNA encoding by Grass Codec.

  1. DNA decoding by Grass Codec.

class methods.gc.GC(base_values=None, need_log=False)¶

Bases: object

decode(dna_motifs)¶

introduction: Decode DNA motifs to the data of binary file.

Parameters

dna_motifs – The DNA motif of len(matrix) rows. The length of each DNA motifs should be a multiple of 9. Type: One-dimensional list(string).

Return matrix

The binary matrix corresponding to the dna motifs. Type: Two-dimensional list(int).

Return file_size

This refers to file size, to reduce redundant bits when transferring DNA to binary files. Type: int

encode(matrix, size)¶

introduction: Encode DNA motifs from the data of binary file.

Parameters

  • matrix – Generated binary two-dimensional matrix. The data of this matrix contains only 0 or 1 (non-char). The length of col should be a multiple of 16. Type: int or bit.

  • size – This refers to file size, to reduce redundant bits when transferring DNA to binary files. Type: int

Return dna_motifs

The DNA motif of len(matrix) rows. Type: list(string).

Name: Simple Codec (Simple DNA Storage Code)

Reference: Church G M, Gao Y, Kosuri S. Next-generation digital information storage in DNA[J]. Science, 2012, 337(6102): 1628-1628.

Blawat M, Gaedke K, Huetter I, et al. Forward error correction for DNA data storage[J]. Procedia Computer Science, 2016, 80: 1011-1022.

Coder: HaoLing ZHANG (BGI-Research)[V1]

Current Version: 1

Function(s): (1) DNA encoding by Simple.

  1. DNA decoding by Simple.

  • size – This refers to file size, to reduce redundant bits when transferring DNA to binary files. Type: int

Return dna_motifs

The DNA motif of len(matrix) rows. Type: list(string).

Name: Huffman Codec (DNA Storage Code based on Huffman code)

Reference: Goldman N, Bertone P, Chen S, et al. Towards practical, high-capacity, low-maintenance information storage in synthesized DNA[J]. Nature, 2013, 494(7435): 77.

Coder: HaoLing ZHANG (BGI-Research)[V1], QianLong ZHUANG (BGI-Research)

Current Version: 1

Function(s): (1) DNA encoding by Huffman Codec.

  1. DNA decoding by Huffman Codec.

introduction: Encode DNA motifs from the data of binary file.

  • size – This refers to file size, to reduce redundant bits when transferring DNA to binary files. Type: int

Return dna_motifs

The DNA motif of len(matrix) rows. Type: list(list(char)).

Name: YYC (Yin-Yang DNA Storage Code)

Reference: None

Coder: HaoLing ZHANG (BGI-Research)[V1]

Current Version: 1

Function(s): (1) DNA encoding by YYC.

  1. DNA decoding by YYC.

Advantages: (1) High compressibility, maximum compressibility to 1/2 of the original data.

  1. Prevent repetitive motifs, like ATCGATCG…

  2. Increase the number of sequence changes (1,536 cases), increasing data security.

class methods.yyc.YYC(base_reference=None, current_code_matrix=None, support_bases=None, support_spacing=0, max_ratio=0.8, search_count=1, need_log=False)¶

introduction: Encode DNA motifs from the data of binary file.

  • size – This refers to file size, to reduce redundant bits when transferring DNA to binary files. Type: int

The DNA motif of len(matrix) rows. Type: list(list(char)).

Utilities¶

Name: Data Handle

Coder: HaoLing ZHANG (BGI-Research)[V1]

Current Version: 1

Function(s): Conversion of DNA motifs and binary document

utils.data_handle.read_binary_from_all(path, segment_length=120, need_log=False)¶

introduction: Reading binary matrix from document.

Parameters

  • path – File path. Type: string

  • segment_length – The cut length of DNA motif. Considering current DNA synthesis factors, we usually set 120 bases as a motif.

  • need_log – need output log.

Return matrix

A corresponding DNA motif string in which each row acts as a motif. Type: two-dimensional list(int)

utils.data_handle.read_dna_file(path, need_log=False)¶

introduction: Reading DNA motif set from documents.

Parameters

  • path – File path. Type: string

  • need_log – need output log.

Return dna_motifs

A corresponding DNA sequence string in which each row acts as a sequence. Type: one-dimensional list(string)

utils.data_handle.write_all_from_binary(path, matrix, size, need_log=False)¶

introduction: Writing binary matrix to document.

Parameters

  • path – File path. Type: string

  • matrix – A corresponding DNA motif string in which each row acts as a motif. Type: two-dimensional list(int)

  • size – This refers to file size, to reduce redundant bits when transferring DNA to binary files. Type: int

  • need_log – need output log.

utils.data_handle.write_dna_file(path, dna_motifs, need_log=False)¶

introduction: Writing DNA motif set to documents.

Parameters

  • path – File path. Type: string

  • dna_motifs – A corresponding DNA sequence string in which each row acts as a sequence. Type: one-dimensional list(string)

  • need_log – need output log.

Name: Log

Coder: HaoLing ZHANG (BGI-Research)[V1]

Current Version: 1

Function(s): Output the logs in console.

utils.log.output(info_type=0, class_name=None, method_name=None, info=None)¶
introduction: Output the logs in console.

Format is: TIME CLASS_NAME -> METHOD_NAME: INFO.

Parameters

  • info_type – Type of information. We have declared three types available now: NORMAL, WARN, and ERROR. If the type is ERROR, we will end this program immediately.

  • class_name – Current class name, used to find the source of the information. It is easy to get it by method “str(__name__)” in the classes you need to export logs to console.

  • method_name – Current method name, used to find the source of the information. It is easy to get it by method “str(sys._getframe().f_code.co_name)” in the classes you need to export logs to console.

  • info – The information hat users want to display in console. Type: String

Name: Model Saver

Coder: HaoLing ZHANG (BGI-Research)[V1]

Current Version: 1

Function(s): (1) Save model to file.

  1. Load model from file.

utils.model_saver.load_model(path, need_log=False)¶

introduction: Load model from file.

Parameters

  • path – The path of file. Type: .pkl

  • need_log – need output log.

Returns

needed model. i.e. YYC or DDC.

utils.model_saver.save_model(path, model, need_log=False)¶

introduction: Save model to file.

Parameters

  • path – The path of file. Usually in the models directory.

  • model – Current model for encoding. Type: .pkl i.e. YYC or DDC.

  • need_log – need output log.

Current Version: 1

Function(s): (1) Get the progress and the time left

Bases: object

output(current_length, total_length)¶

introduction: Print the progress bar for required “for” sentence.

Parameters

  • current_length – Current position of the “for” sentence. Type: int

  • total_length – Total length of the “for” sentence. Type: int
